鳩文竟然讚吉祥物

Ronald Koeman believes that Oumar Niasse could be a secret goalscoring weapon for his previously shot shy Blues – after the Senegal striker opened his goalscoring account for Everton with a strike described by his manager as a “perfect goal.” 

After almost 18-months in exile and a spell on loan at Hull, Niasse returned to the first team fold last week and was on the substitutes' bench for the Carabao Cup third round tie against Sunderland. 

Introduced in the 65th minute with Everton leading 2-0, he sealed the Blues path into the last 16 with a beautifully taken goal at the Gwladys Street End. 

And Koeman thinks that with the pressure off the striker, that could make him an even bigger threat. 

“It was a great goal. A great goal,” said Koeman. “His first touch from his chest and the finish with his right foot was great. It was a perfect goal. 

“Everyone knows it was a difficult situation for him but it is about taking your chance when you get an opportunity. He showed tonight that he is part of the team. 

“You pick the player up and you put the player in the team - and he gave that confidence to the team in a difficult moment for them and maybe he does not feel that pressure and that makes him more even more dangerous for opponents.”

After almost 18-months in exile and a spell on loan at Hull, Niasse returned to the first team fold last week and was on the substitutes' bench for the Carabao Cup third round tie against Sunderland. 

Introduced in the 65th minute with Everton leading 2-0, he sealed the Blues path into the last 16 with a beautifully taken goal at the Gwladys Street End. 

And Koeman thinks that with the pressure off the striker, that could make him an even bigger threat. 

“It was a great goal. A great goal,” said Koeman. “His first touch from his chest and the finish with his right foot was great. It was a perfect goal. 

“Everyone knows it was a difficult situation for him but it is about taking your chance when you get an opportunity. He showed tonight that he is part of the team. 

“You pick the player up and you put the player in the team - and he gave that confidence to the team in a difficult moment for them and maybe he does not feel that pressure and that makes him more even more dangerous for opponents.”

拖肥反勝止血 朗奴高文：百感交集

now.com體育】於英超近4場只得1和3負後，愛華頓周六驚險反勝，終於重上勝軌，領隊朗奴高文坦言百感交集。

愛華頓憑後備前鋒奧馬尼亞斯在末段梅開二度，主場以2:1反勝般尼茅夫。朗奴高文（Ronald Koeman）說：「我在賽後才能夠冷靜下來，今場可真的百感交集，很難踢，我們未能創造太多機會。幸好，我們作出了正確決定，落後0:1時嘗試不同的事，排出雙箭頭，踢得更直接。」

盛讚自己調動得宜之餘，朗奴高文也大讚入球功臣奧馬尼亞斯（Oumar Niasse）：「他帶來更強的侵略性。我們當時需要球員在前鋒卡維特利雲身旁，去壓逼對手，而奧馬尼亞斯就挺身而出。生命就是這樣，當你有機會，就要把握。他等了這個機會很久了。」

http://sports.now.com/mobileweb/news/details?id=19098122160

愛華頓憑後備前鋒奧馬尼亞斯在末段梅開二度，主場以2:1反勝般尼茅夫。朗奴高文（Ronald Koeman）說：「我在賽後才能夠冷靜下來，今場可真的百感交集，很難踢，我們未能創造太多機會。幸好，我們作出了正確決定，落後0:1時嘗試不同的事，排出雙箭頭，踢得更直接。」

盛讚自己調動得宜之餘，朗奴高文也大讚入球功臣奧馬尼亞斯（Oumar Niasse）：「他帶來更強的侵略性。我們當時需要球員在前鋒卡維特利雲身旁，去壓逼對手，而奧馬尼亞斯就挺身而出。生命就是這樣，當你有機會，就要把握。他等了這個機會很久了。」

http://sports.now.com/mobileweb/news/details?id=19098122160

呢條撚樣真係死要面死唔認衰
明明吉祥物救佢一命佢就話係自己調動得宜
仆你個街，一開頭又係你呢條撚樣排鳩陣先搞到失勢失波，呢個唔係佢做出嚟嘅問題咩
講到好似自己掌握哂個形勢咁

Ronald Koeman delivered a scathing assessment of Everton’s Europa League draw against Apollon Limassol as he accused his team of being scared to play football and being “in a difficult situation”.

Héctor Yuste earns 10-man Apollon Limassol draw with sluggish Everton

Everton were held to a 2-2 draw at Goodison Park after Héctor Yuste, who gifted Wayne Rooney a first-half goal, headed in an 88th-minute equaliser for a visiting team reduced to 10 men moments earlier. A point at home to the lowest-ranked team in Group E, following a comprehensive 3-0 defeat away at Atalanta in the opening game, means Everton have made the worst ever start to a Europa League group campaign by an English team. And despite starting without pace and a recognised wide-man in a 4-4-2 formation, Koeman again blamed a lack of confidence for Everton’s latest ponderous performance.


“I cannot say they are not running or fighting but they are afraid of playing,” claimed the Everton manager. “It is in the head of the players. As a manager you can help the team and select the team but when the whistle goes you are not the one who plays the ball back. It is about giving the players options but we are scared to play forward. Sometimes there are not enough options for the forwards but, in that case, play the ball into the channels instead of the goalkeeper. We know the fans like us to go forward, not back, back, back. Then it is difficult to create chances.”

Ronald Koeman has warned Everton's players their hopes of a European adventure will disintegrate if they allow old bad habits to resurface.

Ronald Koeman would consider leaving Everton if players stopped playing for him after latest defeat raises questions

Koeman's side have won just two of their last 10 matches, but manager claims he cannot fault the effort of his Everton players


Ronald Koeman admitted that he would consider his position as Everton manager if he thought his players were not playing for him.

Everton’s 1-0 defeat by Burnley leaves them two points above the Premier League relegation zone despite a record summer of spending at Goodison Park.

Koeman was, however, satisfied by the level of commitment from his Everton team during the loss, sealed by Jeff Hendrick’s excellent first half goal.

“No. I can’t complain from my players today,” Koeman said. “They did everything. There are situations in our ball possession that maybe we can create more but it is not so easy against Burnley. They are a defensive minded team but well organised, physical. You need to be lucky in second balls, maybe everything. The commitment and spirit of the players was really positive.”

He was asked about whether he is disappointed by performances and results considering the club’s recent outlay on players.

“It is always about the money,” Koeman continued. “It is so easy in this situation to speak about the money. We have got a lot of money and we invest some money and it is always about the difference in spending from transfers. We signed a young goalkeeper [Jordan Pickford] and he is doing well and he has improved. We signed young players and we have a lot of young players in the squad.

“Of course, we need to improve in winning games. We know that. What I do is try and get the best from the players. If there is no commitment and no aggression, that is maybe a reason to think about the future.
jeff-hendrick.jpg
Jeff Hendrick secured a 1-0 victory for Burnley at Everton (Getty)

“I have experience and I know if you win your life on a daily basis is different from if you lose. It is not nice to get two weeks an international break if you lose. We will continue and I will try to do my best for the job. All the stuff and the questions is not in my hands.”

Burnley’s victory on Merseyside continues their superb run away from Turf Moor this season. Prior to this win, they had beaten Chelsea on the opening day of the campaign and had since recorded draws at Tottenham Hotspur and Liverpool.

成日話椰子年代鳩斬，睇過三個教練我更加覺得椰子年代嘅組織仲多過馬撚同鳩文
左邊有派拿同拜恩斯疊瓦，派拿可以做分波俾直線，做唔到就交俾拜恩斯出波
中間有阿迪達分波俾直線或吊波，而且仲有遠射
同埋有爆炸頭喺中場線搶波，有時仲可以即時推前當打多個前鋒
右邊就有米拉同高文做突破
前線就有卡希爾頂波，沙夏同卡希爾不斷換位
後面基本無憂，隊長同早期嘅葛仔後期嘅甸甸都守得好穩
死球有阿迪達同拜恩斯夾手處理
當時根本係可燒味可入涉可突擊，防守又穩健，但球會洗費唔大咁先至有蔗渣價錢燒鵝味道嘅稱號
而家就係燒鵝價錢蔗渣味道
